protocol_name: In vitro synthesized mRNA transfection to Perkinsus marinus
protocol_name_html: In vitro synthesized mRNA transfection to Perkinsus marinus
protocol_affiliation: University of Tsukuba,University of British Columbia

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors: Yoshihisa Hirakawa,Hirokazu Sakamoto,Elisabeth Hehenberger,Nick Irwin,Patrick Keeling
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"7iqmu","text":"We created the plasmid vector (T7-SL-eGFP) that the egfp gene with a 5\u2032 UTR of the P. marinus TPT2 gene and a 3\u2032 UTR of the P. marinus MOE gene was inserted in pSP72 (Promega). The 5\u2032 UTR contains the spliced leader sequence (ACCGTAGCCATCTTGGCTCAAG) found in P. marinus nuclear genes. The construct of T7-SL-eGFP can be obtained from  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":83,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":124,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":259,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":334,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"32223","guid":"B30F4820E19511E89D61ED9E78B1977E","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/9q9dt4e.pdf","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/extensions\/pdf.png","original_name":"T7-SL-eGFP.pdf"}}],"guid":"D77C3110E19411E89D61ED9E78B1977E","id":679819,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Plasmid preparation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79mj2","text":"mRNA with a 5\u2032 m7G cap and 3\u2032 poly(A)-tail was synthesized by mMESSAGE mMACHINE T7 Transcription Kit (Ambion) with the linearized plasmid of T7-SL-eGFP (it was digested by PvuII). The synthesized mRNA was treated by TURBO DNase, and collected by ethanol precipitation according to the manufacturer\u2019s instructions. The mRNA concentration was calculated by Qubit 3.0 (Thermo Life Technologies).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":16,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":172,"length":3,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E9331A90E19411E89D61ED9E78B1977E","id":679820,"previous_guid":"D77C3110E19411E89D61ED9E78B1977E","section":"In vivo mRNA synthesis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1em7r","text":"P. marinus cells (5\u00d7107log-phase trophozoites) were collected by a brief centrifugation (3,000 g \u00d7 5 min) and the pellet was resuspended by 100 \u00b5L solution 2 supplied by Basic Parasite Nucleofector Kit 2 (Lonza). Synthesized mRNA was added to the solution in different concentration (1, 5, 10, or 20 \u00b5g). Electroporation was performed by Amaxa Nucleofector II (Lonza) with the D-023 program, and then the cells were transferred to 2 mL fresh medium (ATCC medium 1886) in a 6-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":22,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6A2E8350E19511E89D61ED9E78B1977E","id":679821,"previous_guid":"E9331A90E19411E89D61ED9E78B1977E","section":"Transfection by electroporation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q35e","text":"After 24 to 48 h, transfected cells were observed under an inverted fluorescence microscope with a GFP filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"786D0EF0E19511E89D61ED9E78B1977E","id":679822,"previous_guid":"6A2E8350E19511E89D61ED9E78B1977E","section":"GFP observation"}
